snippet: A comic book property like “Guardians of the Galaxy” may seem ideal for the big screen, but comics have singular pleasures of their own.
abstract: Comic books often read better than films that are made based on them; directors often go for over-the-top action, as in Guardians of the Galaxy, while comics tend to be more intricate stories, with complex plot lines, developed over time, leaving die-hard fans disappointed with what ends up on screen.
lead_paragraph: A comic book property like “Guardians of the Galaxy” may seem ideal for the big screen, but comics have singular pleasures of their own.

headline.seo: From the Printed Comic to 'Guardians of the Galaxy'
headline.main: Imax? Try a Cosmos Between Covers
headline.print_headline: Imax? Try a Cosmos Between Covers
